intro: Symphyandra lezgina, commonly known as the Leningrad symphyandra, is a rare flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Symphyandraceae and is characterized by its unique, spirally arranged leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
